intro: Ateleia insularis, commonly known as the island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a slightly hairy texture, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Ateleia insularis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats.
